items.question: A primary advantage of RIC over custom CIC is:
items.rationale: RICs often offer more features, power options, and easier service.

items.question: Open dome coupling tends to:
choices: Reduce occlusion but limit LF gain
items.rationale: Open fits reduce occlusion perception but limit low-frequency amplification and increase feedback risk.

items.question: A patient with SSD (one normal ear, one unaidable) is best served by:
items.rationale: CROS routes sound from the poor ear side to the better ear.

items.question: BiCROS is used when:
choices: Poor ear unaidable and better ear has aidable loss
items.rationale: BiCROS routes from worse to better ear while also amplifying the better ear.

items.question: Which feature improves SNR by focusing on front speech?
items.rationale: Directional mics improve SNR in specific spatial conditions.

items.question: Frequency lowering is primarily intended to:
items.rationale: Frequency lowering maps high-frequency information into audible ranges.

items.question: For severe–profound SNHL, prefer:
items.rationale: High power with robust coupling is needed for severe–profound losses.

items.question: Pediatric fittings typically use which prescription?
items.rationale: DSL v5 emphasizes audibility across the speech spectrum for children.

items.question: Which vent size effect is TRUE?
choices: Larger vent reduces occlusion but also reduces LF gain
Vent size has no acoustic effect
items.rationale: Bigger vents alleviate occlusion but reduce LF gain and elevate feedback risk.

items.question: Telecoil benefits include:
items.rationale: Telecoils interface with induction loop systems for clearer audio.

items.question: A patient prioritizes cosmetics and sleeps on one ear. Likely style?
items.rationale: IIC/CIC maximize cosmetics and can be comfortable for side sleepers if anatomy permits.

items.question: Tinnitus features in hearing aids primarily aim to:
items.rationale: Sound therapy features can reduce tinnitus perception; they do not cure it.

items.question: Which battery corresponds to color brown?
items.rationale: Size 312 is coded brown (10 yellow, 13 orange, 675 blue).

items.question: For frequent cerumen and moisture exposure, prioritize:
items.rationale: Serviceable receivers and access to maintenance are practical for debris/moisture.

items.question: A patient with poor dexterity benefits from:
choices: Tiny CIC with nail grip only
items.rationale: Rechargeables and larger controls improve usability for dexterity issues.

items.question: Remote microphones are most helpful for:
items.rationale: Remote mics place the mic near the talker, improving SNR in noise/distance.

items.question: For profound high-frequency dead regions, consider:
items.rationale: Lowering can improve access to cues when HF cochlear regions are non-functional.

items.question: Primary goal of compression (WDRC) is to:
choices: Fit wide input levels into reduced DR
items.rationale: WDRC maps a broad range of inputs into a smaller listener dynamic range.

items.question: Which style often best supports very high MPO needs?
items.rationale: Power BTEs provide the highest MPO potential with robust coupling.

items.question: Bluetooth/LE Audio enables:
choices: Direct streaming and control via apps
items.rationale: Modern devices support streaming/control; T-coil and BT address different use-cases.

items.question: Pediatric earmold material preference:
items.rationale: Soft silicone is standard for pediatric comfort and retention.

items.question: A musician with mild HF SNHL values fidelity most. Likely approach:
choices: Low compression ratios and natural response
Max noise reduction and strong directionality
items.rationale: Favor fidelity: gentle processing, appropriate bandwidth, careful directionality/NR settings.

items.question: Telecoil vs Bluetooth—best guidance:
choices: Telecoil excels with loops; Bluetooth excels with personal devices
items.rationale: Each has strengths; many users benefit from both options.

items.question: A large vent is likely to:
items.rationale: Large vents can leak sound and increase feedback risk.

items.question: For sloping SNHL with occlusion complaint, start with:
items.rationale: Open/vented domes reduce occlusion perception for sloping losses.

items.question: Tinnitus programs should be combined with:
items.rationale: Counseling supports effective tinnitus management with sound therapy.

items.question: Which best helps telephone use without smartphone?
items.rationale: Telecoil can couple to phone handsets with adequate magnetic fields (MT/T).

items.question: High feedback risk management includes:
choices: Better seal/vent control and feedback cancellation
items.rationale: Combine physical fit with digital feedback management for best results.

items.question: For fluctuating low-frequency SNHL, consider:
items.rationale: Provide flexibility with programs and counsel about fluctuations.

items.question: Streaming TV clearly in group settings: recommend:
items.rationale: TV streamers deliver clearer audio directly to devices.

items.question: Which user would most benefit from custom ITE?
choices: Needing retention, limited dexterity, moderate loss
items.rationale: Custom ITE can aid handling and retention for certain users and losses.

items.question: For excessive occlusion complaints, you might:
choices: Increase vent size or use more open fit
items.rationale: More open vents reduce occlusion but trade LF gain/feedback.

items.question: For frequent phone/meeting use, prioritize:
items.rationale: Connectivity and remote mic accessories improve communication in these scenarios.

items.question: For narrow/curvy canals with retention issues, consider:
items.rationale: Custom canal molds improve retention and seal in challenging anatomy.

items.question: Primary effect of noise reduction is:
items.rationale: NR mainly reduces annoyance and listening effort; SNR benefits vary.

items.question: Which combination often maximizes power and stability?
choices: Power BTE + thick tubing + full shell mold
items.rationale: Robust coupling reduces leakage and feedback in power fittings.

items.question: Battery color 13 indicates:
items.rationale: Size 13 is orange (312 brown, 10 yellow, 675 blue).

items.question: For basic budget with mild loss and noise concerns, prioritize:
items.rationale: Directionality + remote mic often provide best cost-effective help in noise.

items.question: An unaidable ear with very poor WRS affects selection by:
items.rationale: If one ear is unaidable, route to the better ear (CROS/BiCROS).

items.question: For pediatric fittings, critical measurement is:
items.rationale: RECD personalizes coupler-to-ear conversions in children.
